response.raw:
Here is my suggested response:

Instructing Students Individually and in Groups

1. Use a variety of teaching methods to engage students and accommodate different learning styles: • Lectures to present information and concepts • Class discussions to explore ideas and check for understanding • Demonstrations and modeling to show processes and skills • Hands-on activities and experiments for active learning • Cooperative learning groups for peer interaction and teamwork 2. When instructing individual students: • Assess the student's prior knowledge and skill level • Provide one-on-one guidance and support as needed • Use scaffolding techniques to break down tasks • Give specific, constructive feedback • Allow student choice and autonomy when appropriate 3. When instructing groups of students: • Establish clear expectations and group roles • Foster a collaborative, inclusive environment • Facilitate student-led discussions • Provide opportunities for group projects and presentations • Monitor group dynamics and intervene if necessary to keep students on track 4. Adapt instruction based on formative assessments: • Check for understanding using questioning techniques • Analyze student work to identify misconceptions • Reteach difficult concepts in different ways • Provide differentiated support and enrichment • Adjust pacing and depth based on student needs
response.extracted:
Instructing Students Individually and in Groups

1. Use a variety of teaching methods to engage students and accommodate different learning styles: • Lectures to present information and concepts • Class discussions to explore ideas and check for understanding • Demonstrations and modeling to show processes and skills • Hands-on activities and experiments for active learning • Cooperative learning groups for peer interaction and teamwork 2. When instructing individual students: • Assess the student's prior knowledge and skill level • Provide one-on-one guidance and support as needed • Use scaffolding techniques to break down tasks • Give specific, constructive feedback • Allow student choice and autonomy when appropriate 3. When instructing groups of students: • Establish clear expectations and group roles • Foster a collaborative, inclusive environment • Facilitate student-led discussions • Provide opportunities for group projects and presentations • Monitor group dynamics and intervene if necessary to keep students on track 4. Adapt instruction based on formative assessments: • Check for understanding using questioning techniques • Analyze student work to identify misconceptions • Reteach difficult concepts in different ways • Provide differentiated support and enrichment • Adjust pacing and depth based on student needs
